This is an REST API project build with Laravel 10. The project is structured in a way that follows the standard Laravel conventions, with controllers, models, and routes organized in their respective directories. The API endpoints are designed to be RESTful, allowing for easy integration with frontend applications or other services. The project also includes authentication and authorization features to secure the API endpoints. Overall, this project serves as a solid foundation for building a robust and scalable REST API using Laravel.

All code and comments in this project should be in English and follow the PSR-12 coding standard for PHP. This includes using camelCase for variable and method names, and PascalCase for class names. Additionally, all code should be properly indented and formatted for readability. Comments should be used to explain the purpose of complex code blocks or to provide context for certain decisions made in the code. By adhering to these coding standards, we can ensure that the codebase remains clean, consistent, and maintainable over time.

this project uses Laravel Sail as development environment. All artisan comands should be run using Sail, for example:

```bash
sail artisan migrate
```
